Description: Large, pale green glazed composition amulet in the form of a wedjat-eye with black detail on the brow and pupil. Details shown on both sides. The object is pierced, and the piercing runs through the eyeball as well as the more solid parts of the amulet to the left and right.
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1994 Jan-Mar, Doncaster Museum & Art Gallery, Ancient Egypt
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
